source_sentence: 身壞命終墮三惡道。
translation: When his body breaks up and his life ends, he'll fall into the three bad destinies.

source_sentence: 復見有情起身善行及口意業，不謗賢聖不毀正信，心為正見，起正見業具此業緣，
translation: Again, it is observed that when sentient beings produce wholesome bodily actions as well as verbal and mental action, they do not slander saints and noble ones nor disparage right faith. Their minds are right view. Action of producing right view

source_sentence: 身壞命終得生天上如實知故，是名第九死生智力。
translation: Because he knows as it really is when his body breaks up and his life ends and he's born in heaven, this is called the ninth power of knowledge of death and birth.

source_sentence: 具此力故得名如來、應、正等覺，尊勝殊特雄猛自在，能轉無上清淨梵輪，
translation: Because of these powers they are called buddhas (tathāgatas), arhats, or fully awakened ones. Their supremely superior and most heroic qualities enable them to turn the wheel of unexcelled pure Brahmāhood.

source_sentence: 於大眾中正師子吼。
translation: In the midst of the great assembly, he corrects the lion's roar.

source_sentence: 「復次，如來、應、正等覺，於諸漏盡靜慮，心解脫慧解脫，自證通慧而住，
translation: “Furthermore, the Tathāgatas, Arhats, Perfectly Enlightened Ones abide in meditation on the extinction of all contaminants, their minds liberated from thought, liberated by wisdom, and endowed with penetra

source_sentence: 我生已盡、梵行已立、所作已辦、不受後有，皆如實知。
translation: He knows as it really is: “Birth of the self has ended, the holy life has been established, what was to be done has been done, and there will not be another existence.

source_sentence: 若諸如來、應、正等覺，於漏盡靜慮，心解脫慧解脫，自證通慧而住，
translation: “Furthermore, if the Tathāgatas, Arhats, and Fully Awakened Ones abide in meditation on the extinction of contamination, their minds are liberated by knowledge and wisdom, and they themselves realize transcendent insight

source_sentence: 我生已盡、梵行已立、所作已辦、不受後有，如實知故，是名第十漏盡智力。
translation: Because he knows as it really is: “My births have ended, the holy life has been established, what should be done has been done, and I will not experience another existence.” This is called the tenth power of knowledge regarding the extinction of impure

source_sentence: 具此力故得名如來、應、正等覺，尊勝殊特雄猛自在，能轉無上清淨梵輪，
translation: Because of these powers they are called buddhas (tathāgatas), arhats, or fully awakened ones. Their supremely superior and most heroic qualities enable them to turn the wheel of unexcelled pure Brahmāhood.

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊說是經已，諸苾芻眾，天、龍、藥叉、乾闥婆、阿素洛等，
translation: After the Bhagavān had taught this sūtra, the monks, gods, dragons, yakṣas, gandharvas, asuras, and so forth.

source_sentence: 皆大歡喜，信受奉行。
translation: They all rejoiced greatly and believed it, accepted it, and upheld it.
